description.zh-cn: 中国政治人物，中国共产党早期领导人及中共一大代表，后成为中国国民党官员，抗日战争时期是汪精卫政权的领导人之一。
description.en: Chinese politician, an early leader of the Chinese Communist Party and a delegate to the 1st National Congress of the CCP. He later became a Kuomintang official and one of the leaders of the Wang Jingwei regime during the Second Sino-Japanese War.

description.zh-cn: 中国的执政党。
description.en: The ruling political party of China.

description.zh-cn: 中华民国的创建政党。
description.en: The founding political party of the Republic of China.

en: Reorganized National Government of the Republic of China

description.zh-cn: 抗日战争期间由汪精卫等人在南京成立的政权，被广泛认为是日本的傀儡政权。
description.en: A regime established in Nanjing by Wang Jingwei and others during the Second Sino-Japanese War, widely considered a Japanese puppet state.

nodes.id: 中国共产党第一次全国代表大会

zh-cn: 中国共产党第一次全国代表大会
en: 1st National Congress of the Chinese Communist Party

description.zh-cn: 中国共产党的成立会议。
description.en: The founding congress of the Chinese Communist Party.

description.zh-cn: 中国共产党早期成员，与周佛海共同组建了旅日共产主义小组。
description.en: An early member of the Chinese Communist Party who, along with Zhou Fohai, formed the communist group in Japan.

description.zh-cn: 中国共产党主要创始人之一及早期主要领导人。
description.en: One of the main founders and early paramount leaders of the Chinese Communist Party.

description.zh-cn: 中国共产党早期在日本的组织，由陈独秀指派周佛海和施存统建立。
description.en: An early organization of the Chinese Communist Party in Japan, established by Zhou Fohai and Shi Cuntong under the direction of Chen Duxiu.

description.zh-cn: 位于日本京都市的国立研究型综合大学。
description.en: A national research university located in Kyoto, Japan.

nodes.id: 中国国民党中央宣传部

zh-cn: 中国国民党中央宣传部

description.zh-cn: 中国国民党中央委员会的宣传机构。
description.en: The propaganda agency of the Central Committee of the Kuomintang.

description.zh-cn: 中国国民党早期领导人，抗日战争期间投靠日本，建立汪精卫政权。
description.en: An early leader of the Kuomintang who collaborated with Japan during the Second Sino-Japanese War and established the Wang Jingwei regime.

description.zh-cn: 中华民国政治家及军事家，曾任中华民国总统。
description.en: A Chinese politician and military leader who served as the President of the Republic of China.

description.zh-cn: 中华民国军事人物，国民政府军事委员会调查统计局负责人。
description.en: A Chinese military figure and head of the Bureau of Investigation and Statistics of the National Military Council.

description.zh-cn: 抗日战争时期中华民国国民政府的战时首都和行政中心。
description.en: The wartime capital and administrative center of the Nationalist Government of the Republic of China during the Second Sino-Japanese War.

nodes.id: 军事委员会调查统计局

zh-cn: 军事委员会调查统计局

description.zh-cn: 国民政府的军事情报机构，由戴笠领导。
description.en: The military intelligence agency of the Nationalist Government, led by Dai Li.

description.zh-cn: 周佛海的第二位妻子。
description.en: The second wife of Zhou Fohai.

description.zh-cn: 周佛海与杨淑慧之子。
description.en: Son of Zhou Fohai and Yang Shuhui.

description.zh-cn: 1955年中华人民共和国的一起政治案件，牵连了多名中共干部。
description.en: A political case in the People's Republic of China in 1955 that implicated several CCP cadres.

description.zh-cn: 周佛海是中国共产党早期成员，1921年加入，1924年退党。
description.en: Zhou Fohai was an early member of the Chinese Communist Party, joining in 1921 and leaving the party in 1924.

relationships.target: 中国共产党第一次全国代表大会

position.zh-cn: 日本留学生代表、代理书记
position.en: Representative of Japanese students, Acting Secretary

description.zh-cn: 周佛海作为日本留学生代表出席了中共一大，并担任首任代理书记。
description.en: Zhou Fohai attended the First National Congress of the CCP as a representative of students in Japan and served as the first acting secretary.

description.zh-cn: 陈独秀指派周佛海和施存统为驻日本代表，标志着旅日共产主义小组的正式成立。
description.en: Chen Duxiu appointed Zhou Fohai and Shi Cuntong as representatives in Japan, marking the official establishment of the communist group in Japan.

description.zh-cn: 作为中共早期党员，周佛海接受陈独秀的领导和指派。
description.en: As an early CCP member, Zhou Fohai accepted the leadership and assignments of Chen Duxiu.

description.zh-cn: 周佛海与施存统在1920年代初共同在日本从事共产主义活动，并互相推荐对方出席中共一大。
description.en: In the early 1920s, Zhou Fohai and Shi Cuntong engaged in communist activities together in Japan and mutually recommended each other to attend the First National Congress of the CCP.

description.zh-cn: 周佛海毕业于日本京都大学经济系。
description.en: Zhou Fohai graduated from the Department of Economics at Kyoto University in Japan.

description.zh-cn: 周佛海于1924年加入中国国民党，1940年因投靠汪精卫政权被开除党籍。
description.en: Zhou Fohai joined the Kuomintang in 1924 and was expelled in 1940 for defecting to the Wang Jingwei regime.

relationships.target: 中国国民党中央宣传部

description.zh-cn: 1924年，周佛海回国后担任中国国民党中央宣传部秘书。
description.en: In 1924, after returning to China, Zhou Fohai served as a secretary in the Central Propaganda Department of the Kuomintang.

description.zh-cn: 在1927年蒋介石清党后，周佛海投靠蒋介石，并在其领导下的国民政府中担任多个职务，直至1938年投靠汪精卫。
description.en: After Chiang Kai-shek's party purge in 1927, Zhou Fohai switched his allegiance to Chiang and held several positions in the Nationalist Government under his leadership until defecting to Wang Jingwei in 1938.

description.zh-cn: 汪精卫在南京建立了其领导的国民政府，通称汪精卫政权。
description.en: Wang Jingwei established his Nationalist Government in Nanjing, commonly known as the Wang Jingwei regime.

description.zh-cn: 1938年9月，周佛海与汪精卫一同投向日本，并在汪精卫政权中担任副院长等要职。
description.en: In September 1938, Zhou Fohai, along with Wang Jingwei, defected to the Japanese side, and he held key positions such as Vice Premier in the Wang Jingwei regime.

position.zh-cn: 行政院副院长、财政部长、中央政治委员会秘书长、中央储备银行总裁、上海市长等
position.en: Vice Premier of the Executive Yuan, Minister of Finance, Secretary-General of the Central Political Committee, Governor of the Central Reserve Bank, Mayor of Shanghai, etc.

description.zh-cn: 周佛海在汪精卫政权中担任了多个核心职务。
description.en: Zhou Fohai held multiple core positions in the Wang Jingwei regime.

description.zh-cn: 1943年，戴笠吸收周佛海进入军统，使其成为国民党政府在汪精卫政权中的卧底。
description.en: In 1943, Dai Li recruited Zhou Fohai into the Juntong, making him a spy for the Nationalist Government within the Wang Jingwei regime.

relationships.target: 军事委员会调查统计局

description.zh-cn: 1943年，周佛海被戴笠吸收，秘密成为军统的卧底。
description.en: In 1943, Zhou Fohai was recruited by Dai Li and secretly became an undercover agent for Juntong.

description.zh-cn: 从1942年起，周佛海开始秘密向重庆国民政府投诚，为其提供情报并执行任务。
description.en: Starting from 1942, Zhou Fohai began to secretly pledge allegiance to the Chongqing Nationalist Government, providing intelligence and carrying out missions for it.

description.zh-cn: 抗日战争胜利后，尽管有戴罪立功行为，周佛海仍被国民政府逮捕并判处死刑。
description.en: After the victory of the Second Sino-Japanese War, despite his efforts to redeem himself, Zhou Fohai was arrested by the Nationalist Government and sentenced to death.

description.zh-cn: 1948年，蒋介石签署命令，将周佛海的死刑减为无期徒刑。
description.en: In 1948, Chiang Kai-shek signed an order commuting Zhou Fohai's death sentence to life imprisonment.

description.zh-cn: 1921年，周佛海与杨淑慧私奔至日本结婚，是其第二位妻子。
description.en: In 1921, Zhou Fohai eloped with Yang Shuhui to Japan to get married; she was his second wife.

description.zh-cn: 周幼海是周佛海的儿子。
description.en: Zhou Youhai is the son of Zhou Fohai.

description.zh-cn: 周幼海是杨淑慧的儿子。
description.en: Zhou Youhai is the son of Yang Shuhui.

description.zh-cn: 1955年，周幼海受潘汉年、扬帆反革命案牵连，被关入北京秦城监狱。
description.en: In 1955, Zhou Youhai was implicated in the Pan Hannian and Yang Fan counter-revolutionary case and was imprisoned in Beijing's Qincheng Prison.
